intro: Masdevallia harryana var. denisonii, commonly known as the Denison’s masdevallia, is a rare and striking orchid native to the cloud forests of Colombia. It features intricate, velvety leaves and produces delicate, spurred flowers in shades of pink and white. The plant thrives in cool, humid environments with high air circulation. It requires indirect light and well-draining, acidic soil to flourish. Due to its rarity and specific habitat needs, it is often cultivated in specialized orchid collections.
